Merge pull request #137 from chantra/no_drop

Command line argument to buffer packets instead of dropping

Command line argument to buffer packets instead of dropping

atcd --atcd-dont-drop-packets

This is provided as a workaround for a bunch of issues that were
reported by users where they would prefer packets to be buffered (and
hence providing the expected throughput)  rather than being dropped
causing the network to collapse.

Make sure re-generating thrift files do not override version

When modifying the thrift file, one needs to re-generate the python
classes by running make. This overrided
atc/atc_thrift/atc_thrift/__init__.py and remove thje __version__
variable.

This change just moves the versioning back in setup.py as we do not use
it currently anywhere but with pip.

Merge pull request #62 from peterbe/patch-1

pip oneliner

pip oneliner

There's no need to install one pip package at a time. Especially since it won't stop if any of the previous fails. 
If you do `pip install voiuh2foisf2 a-real-package` it won't install `a-real-package`.

Merge pull request #47 from chantra/fix_auth

Assign the right IP to controllingIP when using the API

Assign the right IP to controllingIP when using the API

Since GH #19 landed, we should have updated the API to correctly fill in
the `controllingIP`.
This diff correctly fills controllingIP from the client IP (handling
proxies if needed) and controlledIP from the `address` (URL, payload or
defaulting to client IP).

Merge pull request #43 from chantra/atcui_setup_provision

run atcui-setup when provisioning a host.

run atcui-setup when provisioning a host.

since django 1.7 (which is one of our requirements), syncdb has been
decoupled. `migrate` only sync the db state but does not prompt to
create a superuser.
https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.7/ref/django-admin/#migrate-app-label-migrationname
This can be ran without user interaction allowing us to automatically
set up our django app!
This also fixes a bug in atcui-setup that was not properly detecting if
it was run as root

Merge pull request #41 from chantra/sqlite_file

Change the default location of atcd's sqlite file.

Change the default location of atcd's sqlite file.

Defaulting to `/var/lib/atc/atcd.db` will cause `atcd` to fail to start
if `/var/lib/atc` is not created before hand.
This will be an issue when people will install from source and we should
default to a directory that we know exists by default on a system.

Merge pull request #31 from chantra/atcd_doc

Documents atcd

Make django apps packages install properly

Most python packages were not installing properly because we did not
define all the packages and package_data that should have been
installed. This issue is not happening when installing in dev mode as a
symlink is created to the actual directory, but when installing using
`pip install package_name`, submodules, templates and static files were
not getting installed.

GH #18
In secure mode, a device can only shape traffic for itself, or devices
it has had controlling access granted to.

This first diff only activate secure mode by default. Granted control to
other device has not been tested as part of this diff.

Test:
start atcd in unsecure mode:
* test_secure_access.py succeed

start atcd in secure mode:
* during start up, the previous shaping saved in DB is ignore:
    WARNING:AtcdVService.AtcdLinuxShaper:Shaping Denied in secure mode,
passing: The device 1.1.1.1 is not allowed to control 2.2.2.2
* try to shape another IP running test_secure_access.py
    TrafficControlException(code=14, _message='The device 1.1.1.1 is not
allowed to control 2.2.2.2') raise
* try to shape self with 'test_secure_access.py --self'
    TrafficControlRc(message=None, code=0)

Merge pull request #12 from chantra/shape_other_ip

Allow shaping a different IP through the URL

Allow shaping a different IP through the URL

The address to shape can be passed through a few locations: the payload or the URL. URL was being ignored so far. This fixes it by correctly passing the address through the view context.
